intro: Critoniella lebrijensis, commonly known as the Lebrijen's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
